intro: Fimbristylis tikushiensis, commonly known as the Tikushi sedge, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or brown in color. Fimbristylis tikushiensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and tidal influences.
